intro: Psychotria villicarpa, commonly known as the "Cocaine plant," is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Central and South America. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. It produces small, dark blue to black berries that contain toxic alkaloids, including cocaine. Due to its psychoactive properties, it is both botanically significant and of considerable legal and medicinal interest.
